Package daniel.nofulla.homework2

Class Heap<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • daniel.nofulla.homework2.Heap<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ADTHeap<T>
    public class Heap<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ADTHeap<T>
    This is the generic Heap Class (Specifically, this is a MAX HEAP)
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Daniel Nofulla

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Heap()
      Constructs a new empty heap with a Name Comparator reference
      Heap​(Comparator<T> newComparator)
      Constructs a new Heap with a reference to a comparator (Name Comparator or Pay Rate Comparator)
      Heap​(Heap<T> newHeap, Comparator<T> newComparator)
      Constructs a new Heap from another heap's elements and with a reference to a comparator
      Heap​(java.util.ArrayList<T> newArrayList, Comparator<T> newComparator)
      Constructs a new Heap from an ArrayList and with a reference to a comparator
      Heap​(T[] newArray, Comparator<T> newComparator)
      Constructs a new Heap from an array's elements and with a reference to a comparator

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void buildHeap()
      The buildHeap method builds the max heap.
      T delete()
      The delete method deletes the root (biggest) element from the heap and returns the element deleted.
      void exchange​(int i, int j)
      The exchange method swaps the elements at the two positions passed as references.
      Comparator<T> getComparator()
      The getComparator method returns the Comparator of the Heap
      int getCompType()
      The getCompType method returns the compType integer value of the heap
      int getHeapSize()
      The getHeapSize method returns the size of the heap
      int getLeftChildPos​(int i)
      The getLeftChildPos method gets the Left Child Index Position of the current index
      java.util.ArrayList<T> getList()
      The getList method returns the ArrayList where the heap is stored
      int getParentPos​(int i)
      The getParentPos method gets the Parent Index Position of the current index
      int getRightChildPos​(int i)
      The getRightChildPos method gets the Right Child Index Position of the current index
      void heapify​(int i)
      Heapify recursively loops to adjust the array in the correct order by swapping elements between parent nodes (current index) and child nodes (left and right child positions)
      void increaseKey​(int i, T item)
      The increaseKey method is used within the insert method in order to properly reorganize a heap after an element is inserted at the end of the heap and move it up.
      void insert​(T item)
      The insert operation first builds the max heap in order to make the insertion process flawless.
      boolean isEmpty()
      The isEmpty method checks if the heap is empty
      void setComparator​(Comparator<T> comparator)
      The setComparator method sets the Comparator of the Heap to a reference of another Comparator and then builds the max heap.
      void setCompType​(int compType)
      The setCompType method sets the compType to a Reference of a compType passed as a parameter.
      void setHeapSize​(int heapSize)
      The setHeapSize method set the heapSize to a reference heapSize value
      void setList​(java.util.ArrayList<T> list)
      The setList method sets the ArrayList of the Heap to a reference of another ArrayList and then builds the max heap.
      void sort()
      The sort method performs the heapsort operation on a max heap using max heapify to set the items in the heap in sorted order (smallest to biggest)
      java.lang.String toString()
      The toString method returns the list/heap's elements formatted as a String.

    • Method Detail

      • buildHeap

        public void buildHeap()
        The buildHeap method builds the max heap. We set the heap's size to the max heap and then we loop and heapify the heap with a loop until all the parent nodes are bigger than the nodes of their children and the max heap is built.

      • insert

        public void insert​(T item)
            throws HeapException
        The insert operation first builds the max heap in order to make the insertion process flawless. After building the max heap, we increase the heap's size by 1, add it to the heap's list, and increase the key of that item so that the heap is adjusted accordingly.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface ADTHeap<T>
        Parameters:
        item - The reference to a generic item
        Throws:
        HeapException - Throws the HeapException

      • increaseKey

        public void increaseKey​(int i,
                        T item)
                 throws HeapException
        The increaseKey method is used within the insert method in order to properly reorganize a heap after an element is inserted at the end of the heap and move it up.
        Parameters:
        i - Reference to the current index
        item - Reference to the item added in theheap
        Throws:
        HeapException - Throws the HeapException

      • delete

        public T delete()
         throws HeapException
        The delete method deletes the root (biggest) element from the heap and returns the element deleted. We first build the max heap to ensure a flawless deletion.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface ADTHeap<T>
        Returns:
        Returns the item deleted (the root of the heap)
        Throws:
        HeapException - Throws the HeapException

      • heapify

        public void heapify​(int i)
        Heapify recursively loops to adjust the array in the correct order by swapping elements between parent nodes (current index) and child nodes (left and right child positions)
        Specified by:
        heapify in interface ADTHeap<T>
        Parameters:
        i - Reference to the current index

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        The isEmpty method checks if the heap is empty
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface ADTHeap<T>
        Returns:
        Returns true if the heapSize is 0

      • sort

        public void sort()
        The sort method performs the heapsort operation on a max heap using max heapify to set the items in the heap in sorted order (smallest to biggest)
        Specified by:
        sort in interface ADTHeap<T>

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The toString method returns the list/heap's elements formatted as a String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns the list/heap's elements formatted as a String

        public void exchange​(int i,
                     int j)
        The exchange method swaps the elements at the two positions passed as references.
        Parameters:
        i - Reference of the index of the first element
        j - Reference of the index of the second element
